greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows, T(n,k) n>=0, 0<=k<=n; T(0,0) = -1 and for n > 0 T(n,k) = moebius(n,k+1) - moebius(n,k) where moebius(n,k) = mu(floor(n/k)) if k<>0 and k divides n, 0 otherwise; mu=A008683.
comment: This is a variant of Paul D. Hanna's A123706 which uses a definition given by Mats Granvik. It adds the column T(n,0) = mu(n) at the left hand side of the triangle.
The value T(0,0) was set to -1 to make the triangle invertible as a matrix with uniform signs of the entries of the inverse.
example: The inverse of this triangle as a matrix begins
mathematica: mu[n_, k_] := If[k != 0 && Divisible[n, k], MoebiusMu[n/k], 0];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 11}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 12 2019 *)
program: def mur(n,k): return moebius(n//k) if k != 0 and n%k == 0 else 0
def A206706(n,k) : return -1 if n==0 and k==0 else mur(n,k+1) - mur(n,k)
results.author: _Peter Luschny_, Feb 11 2012
